data.title: Pink Ribbon Good
data.text:
EVERY 90 SECONDS, SOMEONE IN THE US IS DIAGNOSED WITH BREAST CANCER. HEARING “YOU HAVE CANCER” CHANGES EVERYTHING.

“I scheduled a mammogram because I thought it was something you did at 40. I didn’t have any signs or symptoms. Quickly, I was lost in a world of appointments, tests and decisions. PRG provides a sisterhood, hope and helps you to not feel alone.”

CASSIE B.

PINK RIBBON GOOD EXISTS TO SERVE EVERY PERSON AND FAMILY AFFECTED BY BREAST AND GYNECOLOGICAL CANCER. WE PROVIDE FREE HEALTHY MEALS, RIDES TO TREATMENT, HOUSECLEANING ESSENTIALS AND PEER SUPPORT SO NO ONE IS ALONE IN THE FIGHT.

“I was totally devastated, but I knew I had to fight. PRG became the friend I truly needed. In a time of darkness, PRG has chosen to be part of the light.”

ERICA C.

Doorstep delivery of delicious meals that can be cooked in minutes for our clients and their family members

Treatment is tough enough; Pink Ribbon Good will make sure you get there on time and back home safely

For a clean environment in which to heal, PRG provides all-natural cleaning products and a lightweight vacuum

To combat the isolation many feel after a cancer diagnosis, we offer both in-person

and virtual peer support events

PRG IS A RAINBOW IN THE STORM THAT CANCER CREATES.

BE PART OF THE MAGIC.

You don’t need to be an oncologist or a scientist looking for a cure. A cure is too late for those just diagnosed with breast or gynecological cancer. What they need is a ride to treatment, a clean home in which to heal and to not have to worry about getting dinner on the table. Be someone who lends a hand to a family that’s in the fight of their life through your donation to PRG.

WE CAN ALL FIGHT CANCER.

I can truly say that I have experienced a before-PRG and after-PRG shift in my work. Your robust transportation and meal support is a significant part of the practical help I am able to offer my clients. The quality of life and well-being of so many women with cancer here in San Francisco has been immeasurably enhanced by your services and staff. Long Live PRG!

Lezak S., Care Navigator, Shanti Women’s Cancer Program

FIRST FOUR FIGHTERS

FROM THESE FOUR, TO SERVING FIGHTERS IN 6 REGIONS AND PROVIDING PEER SUPPORT AND EDUCATION TO THOSE BATTLING ACROSS THE COUNTRY

BUT THERE ARE SO MANY OTHER PEOPLE BATTLING BREAST AND GYNECOLOGICAL CANCER ACROSS THE COUNTRY AND THAT’S WHY PRG IS DETERMINED TO KEEP EXPANDING TO NEW REGIONS.

BECAUSE NO ONE, NO MATTER WHERE THEY LIVE, SHOULD HAVE TO TRAVEL THIS ROAD ALONE.

“I always say, if cancer was truly a gift, I would return it. However, what I am grateful for are the amazing heroes that I would never have met without cancer. Countless incredible people that have come into my life and changed it forever. Those that teach you the true meaning of life: people, relationships, living in the moment, and genuine love for each other.”

HEATHER SALAZAR, President and CEO PRG

THOSE BATTLING CANCER WILL ALWAYS BE OUR HEROES. BUT SO ARE THOSE WHO BELIEVE IN OUR MISSION AND HAVE JOINED THE PRG FAMILY.

Feel good about your donation knowing that you’re making a big difference during someone’s cancer journey. Just knowing someone is out there supporting them might be exactly what is needed to find the strength to fight another day.
